intro: Obione konigii, commonly known as the Persian violet, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a long history of use in traditional medicine. Obione konigii is relatively low maintenance and suitable for rock gardens or containers.
